conclusion: Choose a convenient coordinate system with the coast line as the x-axis, Point A on the beach at A(xA, +h), and Point B in the sea at B(xB, -d).
Xiao-Ming will leave the beach at point P(x, 0) on the coast, run from A to P at speed v1, then swim from P to B at speed v2 (v1 > v2).
Write the total time T(x) as a function of x: T(x) = AP / v1 + PB / v2 = 1/v1·√[(x – xA)² + h²] + 1/v2·√[(x – xB)² + d²].
Differentiate T with respect to x and set dT/dx = 0 to minimize the time: dT/dx = 1/v1 · (x – xA)/√[(x – xA)² + h²] + 1/v2 · (x – xB)/√[(x – xB)² + d²] = 0.
Translate the derivatives into sines/cosines of the path angles: cos α = (x – xA)/√[(x – xA)² + h²], cos β = (x – xB)/√[(x – xB)² + d²].
Insert cos α and cos β into the condition dT/dx = 0: (1/v1) cos α + (1/v2) cos β = 0 ⟹ cos α / v1 = – cos β / v2.
With absolute values, obtain Snell's rule for least-time: cos α / v1 = cos β / v2.
Solve for the required ratio: v1 / v2 = cos α / cos β.
Final answer: v₁ / v₂ = cos α / cos β.
